title: Person swings from Point 1 to 2 and lets go

content.question: A person starting from rest at point <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> swings along a circular arc from a rope, as shown above. Point <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></math> is at a lower height than point <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>. What is the trajectory of the person when the person lets go of the rope at Point <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a diagram of the trajectory of a person starting from rest, swinging along a circular arc from a rope, and then letting go of the rope. The height of the starting point is labeled h, and the person lets go of the rope at a height of less than h. The trajectory after the person lets go of the rope is a circular arc similar to, but shorter than, the arc traveled from the starting point to the release point. The highest point of the arc after release is the same as the height of the starting point.

The trajectory after the person lets go of the rope is a curve that moves down and to the right, gradually at first and then more steeply, and ends on the ground a short distance to the right of the release point.
